clinical_study.brief_title: Compare Hemodynamic Parameters of Propofol and Sevoflurane During CPB Time in Undergoing CABG to Avoid Lactate Level
clinical_study.official_title: To Compare Hemodynamic Parameters of Propofol and Sevoflurane During Cardiopulmonary Bypass Time in Patients Undergoing Coronary Artery Bypass Graft (CABG) Surgery to Avoid Lactate Level.

lead_sponsor.agency: Chaudhry Pervaiz Elahi Institute of Cardiology

clinical_study.source: Chaudhry Pervaiz Elahi Institute of Cardiology

brief_summary.textblock: Hemodynamic parameters and lactate level will be on CBP during CABG surgery patients.

detailed_description.textblock:
Objective: To compare hemodynamic parameters of propofol and sevoflurane during cardiopulmonary bypass time in patients undergoing coronary artery bypass graft (CABG) surgery to avoid lactate level.
Methods: One hundred and twenty six patients scheduled for CABG from May 2017 to May 2018 will be included in this study. Non probability consecutive sampling will be used. Patients will be divided in two groups, propofol will be given to group 1, and sevoflurane will be given to group 2. Age, clamp time, bypass time, mean arterial blood pressure on bypass machine and lactate level will be compared between two groups. SPSS version 24 will used and p value â‰¤ 0.05 will be considered as significant.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Lactate level will be measured during CPB for CABG patients to see the hemodynamics parameters
primary_outcome.description: The mean pre-cross clamp lactate level and post- rewarming lactate level will be calculated to see the effect of this on the CABG patients hemodynamics during CBP

arm_group.arm_group_label: group 1 Profol Infusion to CABG patients to check lactate level
arm_group.description: Propofol infusion according to bodyweight will be given to check lactate level on CPB

arm_group.arm_group_label: sevoflurane will be given to group 2 to check lacate level
arm_group.description: Sevoflurane MAC % will be given to CABG patients to check lactate level

intervention.description: Propofol infusion according to body weight will be compared with sevoflurane acording to MAC % to see the lactate level and hemodynamic parameters of CABG patients
intervention.arm_group_label: group 1 Profol Infusion to CABG patients to check lactate level
sevoflurane will be given to group 2 to check lacate level

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
CABG
Exclusion Criteria:
Emergency surgery
